00040 #ifndef _uilinelist_h
00041 #define _uilinelist_h
00042 
00043 #include "vector2.h"
00044 #include "colourvalue.h"
00045 #include "enumerations.h"
00046 
00047 namespace Gorilla
00048 {
00049     class LineList;
00050 }
00051 
00052 namespace phys
00053 {
00054     class UILayer;
00055     class UIManager;
00056     namespace UI
00057     {
00058         ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00059         /// @class phys::UI::Linelist
00060         /// @headerfile uilinelist.h
00061         /// @brief This is an object comprised of a series of lines.
00062         /// @details This class isn't an object, but rather just a series of lines.  As such it
00063         /// doesn't have a position or size.  The position functions exist only to create additional
00064         /// points for the lines to connect.
00065         ///////////////////////////////////////
00066         class PHYS_LIB LineList
00067         {
00068             protected:
00069                 Gorilla::LineList* GLineList;
00070                 UILayer* Parent;
00071                 UIManager* Manager;
00072             public:
00073                 /// @brief Class constructor.
00074                 /// @param Layer Pointer to the parent Layer that created this rectangle.
00075                 LineList(UILayer* Layer);
00076                 /// @brief Class destructor.
00077                 virtual ~LineList();
00078                 /// @brief Sets the visibility of this rectangle.
00079                 /// @param Visible Bool determining whether or not this rectangle should be visible.
00080                 virtual void SetVisible(bool Visible);
00081                 /// @brief Gets the visibility of this rectangle.
00082                 /// @return Returns a bool representing the visibility of this rectangle.
00083                 virtual bool IsVisible();
00084                 /// @brief Forces this rectangle to be shown.
00085                 virtual void Show();
00086                 /// @brief Forces this rectangle to hide.
00087                 virtual void Hide();
00088                 /// @brief Starts a new line list.
00089                 /// @details If this function is called while lines have already been defined, it will
00090                 /// clear the current list of lines and start a new list.
00091                 /// @param Thickness The thickness of the line to draw in pixels.
00092                 /// @param Colour The colour of the line.
00093                 void Begin(Whole Thickness, const ColourValue& Colour);
00094                 /// @brief Adds a new point/line to the list via 2 reals.
00095                 /// @param X Relative coordinate on the X vector.
00096                 /// @param Y Relative coordinate on the Y vector.
00097                 void AddPoint(const Real X, const Real Y);
00098                 /// @brief Adds a new point/line to the list via a vector2.
00099                 /// @param Position A vector2 representing the relative position on screen.
00100                 void AddPoint(const Vector2 Position);
00101                 /// @brief Adds a new point/line to the list via 2 reals.
00102                 /// @param X Coordinate on the X vector.
00103                 /// @param Y Coordinate on the Y vector.
00104                 void AddActualPoint(const Real X, const Real Y);
00105                 /// @brief Adds a new point/line to the list via a vector2.
00106                 /// @param Position A vector2 representing the position on screen.
00107                 void AddActualPoint(const Vector2 Position);
00108                 /// @brief Finalizes the list and prepares it for rendering.
00109                 /// @param Closed Whether or not the line list connects back to it's starting position.  If
00110                 /// true this will create one last line connecting the last provided position with the first.
00111                 void End(bool Closed = false);
00112                 /// @brief Sets the priority this button should be rendered with.
00113                 /// @details The default value for this is Medium.
00114                 /// @param Priority The priority level to be used when rendering this button.
00115                 virtual void SetRenderPriority(UI::RenderPriority Priority);
00116                 /// @brief Gets the priority this button should be rendered with.
00117                 /// @return Returns an enum value representing this button's priority level.
00118                 virtual UI::RenderPriority GetRenderPriority();
00119         };//listlist
00120     }//UI
00121 }//phys
00122 
00123 #endif
